p: Ocimum gratissimum L. (Lamiaceae) is an aromatic perennial herb wildly grown in Nigeria. It is commonly known as Scent leaf or “Nchuanwa” in Igbo, “Effirin” in Yoruba, and “Dai doyatagida” in Hausa (Orwa et al. 2009, Okoli et al. 2010). The plant is used as food spice (Okwu 2006) and for the treatment of many infections (Rabelo et al. 2003). In Nigeria, the repellent activity of ointments formulated with O. gratissimum oil has been reported against Ae. aegypti and Culex quinquefasciatus mosquitoes (Esimone et al. 2011).
